comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Trying to work out if the photos were taken from St Andrews Cathedral Towers or Sydney Town Hall clock tower (completed 1873) ...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Found it - as usual when looking for something else! These are images 9 & 10 (of 10) from a 360 degree PANORAMA of Sydney taken from the top of the (just built) Sydney Town Hall tower, by photographer Francis Whitfield Robinson in 1873. See SLNSW version and blurb - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemDetailPaged.aspx?itemID=913097# Image 9 - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/album/ItemViewer.aspx?itemid=949491&am... Image 10 - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/album/ItemViewer.aspx?itemid=949491&am...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Date proof - SMH 5/12/1873 p.4, col 6 near the bottom - "View of Sydney" - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/page/1450410

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] No I certainly didn't know this already! Well done!! ...and keep looking for something else!!!

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: Like the drinking fountain image, nice to now have a date and photographer.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Yes, 'when' and 'who' is interesting. I think I have the 'why' this photo ended up in the State Rail Authority Archives, Series 17420. In the middle distance is a railway viaduct around the edge of Darling Harbour, the goods line. Not sure if it is complete here or under construction - it seems to end on a jetty. Shown on this 1875 interactive map as ending near Pyrmont Bridge at "Goods Statn." - www.nla.gov.au/apps/cdview/?pi=nla.map-f110-sd&rgn=0.... And planned for on this 1858 map - www.nla.gov.au/apps/cdview/?pi=nla.map-rm1272-sd&rgn=... Railway enthusiasts input required .... Darling Harbour has been infilled so much since, that dry land is what we are used to!
